result.execSummary:
The defendant Desmond R. Poling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to the prison sentence presently being served on 21 CF 318, to commence upon defendant's discharge date after extended supervision ends.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and follow through counseling.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, work search or combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process. 

Any other counseling, treatment, assessments as recommended by the agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on July 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:30 PM Defendant Desmond R. Poling appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail.  Attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brian David Van Ells appeared by video for Desmond R. Poling. Inducement made.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over for further proceedings.  Arraignment held. Defendant waives the reading of the Information. Not guilty plea entered to the charge(s) contained in the Information. Defendant waives right to substitution.  States offer to be given to defense/defendant by June 17, 2022.
Scheduling conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant in custody appearing from Ozaukee County Jail.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 05-18-22 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.   
Minutes.
Brian Van Ells, through public defender.
Initial appearance on May 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant appeared in custody from Ozaukee County Jail on another pending Branch 2 matters.  This matter was discussed.  Judge Dietz cancels the warrant and sets the Initial appearance for 03-17-22 at 2:00 p.m. which is the next court date on the other matter.
